question: What happens when a foreign bank operating in India does not meet its priority sector targets?
option1: It can deposit amount equivalent to the shortfall in Rural Infrastructure Development Fund
option2: It can deposit amount equivalent to the shortfall in SIDBI
option3: It can deposit amount equivalent to the shortfall in RBI
option4: It can lend amount equivalent to the shortfall to domestic banks
answer: It can deposit amount equivalent to the shortfall in SIDBI
explanation: Domestic banks having a shortfall in lending to priority sector/ agriculture are allocated amounts for contribution to the Rural Infrastructure Development Fund (RIDF) established in Nabard. <u>In case of foreign banks operating in India</u>, which fail to achieve the priority sector lending target or sub-targets, an amount equivalent to the shortfall is required to be deposited with <u>SIDBI for one year</u>.
